pageContext.description: Typology: bl. with flattened to rounded midrib - most edges with trace of concave e.bev.; v. sl. medial ridge at top of bl. on one face; knobs very asymmetrically placed - with fairly angular crests; unusual treatment of tang sides - as if attempt to remove a strip of metal by punching a groove deeply from one face - but unfinished; on both sides mainly punched from one face causing dislocation, but also more limited punching from app. face; grooves tend to fade out into bl. shs. or sides of tang.,Manufacture: strs. along one face, bl. & tang, prob. anc. - go under lumpy corr.Condition: es. v. little irreg. from corr. but mainly intact - parts sharp. butt appears undamd.
pageContext.surface: dull grey-brown sur., most obscured by granular textured coppery and vivid fir green sur.; odd spots of bright green corr.
pageContext.other: Modern card, fields do not match data entry template
pageContext.publications: Bibliog: a) Read 1899-1901, 387-8 no.1, fig.,b) Goodman MS, 87, 93 fig.
